At 81, I may not have enough years or brain power left to master this not-intuitive Windows 11, which appears to me, to be a bastard mix of Smartphone and Desktop put out by a company that wants total control or at a minimum to grant as little control as possible to the user of the operating system--we will teach you how to think our way or get a pencil and piece of paper.

title: Images Rendering With Green Tint/Filter
content:
Using Firefox Developer Edition 132.0b9 (64-bit). Also verified same issue in regular FF. Tested in Chrome to be sure it's Firefox related. No issues in Chrome.

It's very random, but sometimes images will render with a slight green tint to them. When I save the image it doesn't have the tint but I've also included a screenshot to show how the render looks.

Things I've tried:

  • Disabling hardware acceleration
  • Changing every setting related to gfx.color in about.config and restarting browser (multiple times/tests)
  • Using devtools to see if it's a server side issue with the particular website

At this point I'm moving on because I cannot find a fix so this was my last resort.

Link to the specific website where the image lives: https://www.crossvilleinc.com/getmedia/dc3bdab1-5d51-40b3-a6c8-dc2fce8b5a1d/ASK03-Mink-24x24-ALASKA.jpg?height=1350?width=1350

title: Mensaje 'Esperando permiso de ubicación'
content:
Hola.

Desde hace una semana y media, cada vez que abro el navegador me sale el siguiente mensaje: 'Esperando permiso de ubicación. Otorgar permiso de ubicación a Firefox en la configuración del sistema' e inmediatamente se abre la configuración de Windows en la opción Privacidad y Seguridad -> Ubicación.

Siempre he tenido la ubicación desactivada y en otro pc tengo la misma selección y no me pasa esto cuando abro Firefox. Tampoco pasa con otros navegadores en ninguno de mis pc's.

Es realmente molesto y jamás me ha pasado esto. Coincidió con la última actualización de Firefox, no sé si tendrá que ver con eso... En los ajustes del navegador tengo permitida la ubicación a los lugares que quiero, así como los permisos en Información de la página. El mensaje deja de salir si activo la ubicación en la configuración de Windows, claro, pero yo quiero seguir teniéndola desactivada. Por favor, ¿qué puedo hacer para que deje de salirme el mensaje y abrirse la configuración de Windows una y otra vez?

Dejo capturas con las versiones de Firefox y Windows, ambas con las últimas actualizaciones instaladas, así como captura del tedioso mensaje de ubicación que, aunque no se ve, abre la vez la ventana de configuración de Windows.

Muchas gracias
creator: nerudavdo

title: Bank Bill Pay not working after v131.0.3 install
content:
I was very excited to see in the 131.0.3 release notes that it fixed a problem with bill pay. I've been unable to use bill pay at my small local bank since v131. My bank was unable to help me and I couldn't get bill pay to work with v131 even after opening everything up as much as I knew how (cookies, trackers, etc.).


Sadly, v 131.0.3 still has the same behavior of blocking bill pay with a very similar message to the BOA message posted earlier.

My local bank uses a site named: web13.secureinternetbanking.com and in the past, I also needed to exempt cookies from sites named: cwsb40.checkfreeweb.com and cw411.checkfreeweb.com. I've also added these sites to the exceptions list for enhanced tracking without effect.

I found a thread on Mozilla Connect from ipv6_fan that seemed to indicate a solution.

Based on that thread, I checked the following parameters:

The value of network.cookie.cookieBehavior.optInPartitioning is false.

The value of network.cookie.CHIPS.enabled is true. 

When I set network.cookie.CHIPS.enabled to false, my billpay popped up as usual.

This seems to indicate (to a novice like me) that there are still issues in 131.0.3 with partitioned cookies.

To make this point, yesterday I spent probably an hour and a 1/2 trying to get to another bank account on Barclays working again because they just "upgraded their web experience". I think I was able to get all the new URLs identified for my exception list for cookies, but blocking cross tracking also creates havoc and I had to turn it off to get the bank site to work. I tried to add sites to the exception list for cross tracking, but firefox still showed it was blocking trackers even though I had added it to the exception list - so I gave up after all that time.

I appreciate the additional security being built into Firefox, but it seems to not play well with banks who seem to be on their own path for increasing security. These two paths don't seem to be converging.

I hope this doesn't sound ungrateful. Thanks for working on this.
creator: miclassb30
